boat.name: Pathfinder 3
boat.full_description:
'Pathfinder 3' is a modern interpretation of the traditional canoe yawl designed for the home builder. At 16 feet (5.0m) in length and a hull weight of only 95kg she easily passes the ‘able to be transported within a traditional railway guards-van’ test for the genre.

The craft utilises ‘stitch and tape’ construction and a unique ‘single plank’ per side build concept which avoids traditional framing and planking.

'Pathfinder 3' was built in Ullapool by Chris Perkins in a little under 3 months and launched in 2011 at the Portsoy Traditional Boat Festival.

Originally designed for raids (and able to sport two banks of oars), the craft has proved an effective and quick ‘all-rounder’ acquitting herself well at OGA rallies and other events for traditional craft.

Fyne Boat Kits of Cumbria market the 14’ 6” version as a kit, details of which can be found on their website.
